com.example.cshare.ui.viewmodels

Class CartViewModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel
      • androidx.lifecycle.AndroidViewModel
        • com.example.cshare.ui.viewmodels.CartViewModel

  • public class CartViewModel
extends androidx.lifecycle.AndroidViewModel
    ViewModel class responsible for preparing and managing the list of in cart products data for the CartFragment and the HomeScreenActivity

    This class provides one the one hand getter methods to retrieve data from the attributes. One the other hand, it provides methods that will directly call request manager methods to perform some actions on the data.

    Since:
    2.1
    Author:
    Clara Gros, Babacar Toure
    See Also:
    AndroidViewModel, CartFragment, HomeScreenActivity, CartDataSourceFactory, LiveData, PagedList

    • Field Detail

      • cartProductsDataSourceFactory

        private CartDataSourceFactory cartProductsDataSourceFactory

      • productPagedList

        private androidx.lifecycle.LiveData<androidx.paging.PagedList<Product>> productPagedList
        Collection wrapped in a LiveData object that loads data in pages, asynchronously. It is used to load in cart product list from our remote source and present it easily in your UI within our RecyclerView.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CartViewModel

        public CartViewModel(android.app.Application application)
              throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException,
                     java.io.IOException
        Class constructor

        First gets an instance of the DataSourceFactory class and configures the PagedList.config. Then initializes the pageList using the created config and DatasourceFactory

        Throws:
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        Application, CartDataSourceFactory, PagedList.Config, PagedList

        Getter method for the pagedList

      • refresh

        public void refresh()
        Reloads all content to get a new version of data, by calling invalidate on the current DataSource.
        See Also:
        DataSource.invalidate()
